javadoc: A class to represent a PATH item.

methods.javadoc:
Identifies an absolute directory path which has the following attributes:
  • isEnabled = true
  • isEditable = true
  • isReadOnly = false
@param path absolute directory path
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Identifies an absolute directory path which has the following attributes:
 
 isEnabled = true
 isEditable = true
 isReadOnly = false

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Identifies an absolute directory path with the specified attributes.

params.name: isEnabled
params.comment: directory path will be searched if true

params.name: isEditable
params.comment: if true files contained within directory are considered editable

params.name: isReadOnly
params.comment: if true files contained within directory are considered read-only

methods.javadoc:

  • isEditable = true
  • isReadOnly = false
@param path absolute directory path @param enabled directory path will be searched if true
methods.name: <init>

Identifies an absolute directory path which has the following attributes:
 
 isEditable = true
 isReadOnly = false

params.name: enabled
params.comment: directory path will be searched if true

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Identifies an absolute directory path with the specified attributes.

params.name: isEnabled
params.comment: directory path will be searched if true

params.name: isEditable
params.comment: if true files contained within directory are considered editable

params.name: isReadOnly
params.comment: if true files contained within directory are considered read-only

methods.name: isReadOnly
methods.comment:
Returns true if this path is read-only, which
 indicates the path cannot be written.

return.comment: true if this path is read-only

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this path can be modified.
@return true if this path can be modified
methods.name: isEditable
methods.comment: Returns true if this path can be modified.

return.comment: true if this path can be modified

methods.name: isEnabled
methods.comment:
Returns true if this path is enabled.
 Enablement indicates the path should be used.

return.comment: true if this path is enabled

methods.name: getPathAsString
methods.comment:
Returns the path as a string with path element placeholders, such as 
 #GHIDRA_HOME.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the given path is a file inside of the current Ghidra application.
@return true if the given path is a file inside of the current Ghidra application.
methods.name: isInstallationFile
methods.comment: Returns true if the given path is a file inside of the current Ghidra application.

return.comment: true if the given path is a file inside of the current Ghidra application.

name: Path
